name: MissionControlWeeklyBrief
summary: ATLAS mission control weekly brief for leadership alignment.
description: Tailor the weekly brief for ATLAS operations, aligning product, engineering, and go-to-market stakeholders on risks and commitments.
acceptance_criteria: Summarizes completed, in-progress, and blocked initiatives with responsible owners.
Highlights the top operational risks alongside mitigation steps and decision deadlines.
Links to source dashboards or tickets so leadership can verify status changes.

name: AutomationPolicyPrecheck
summary: ATLAS automation policy precheck for mission tooling changes.
description: Validate automation changes touching ATLAS mission control systems against governance, audit, and privacy controls before rollout.
acceptance_criteria: Confirms applicable automation and change-management policies for the proposed update.
Documents potential compliance risks with recommended mitigations or required approvals.
Records change ticket references and the go/no-go recommendation with accountable approvers.

name: AtlasSignalRouting
summary: Map daily signals to Atlas workstreams and owners.
description: Review the collected daily signals, align them to Atlas missions, and capture routing notes for downstream execution teams.
acceptance_criteria: Associates each prioritized signal with an Atlas workstream and accountable owner.
Identifies blockers or dependencies requiring follow-up actions within the mission tracker.
Updates severity, confidence, and next-step fields in the shared routing workspace.

triggers: No owner assigned for a high-severity signal

name: PlanLaunchReview
summary: Coordinate Atlas launch readiness review logistics.
description: Schedule the review, confirm stakeholders, and assemble the latest launch artefacts for the session.
acceptance_criteria: Secures availability from required stakeholders and confirms the review agenda.
Collects the most recent launch plan, risk register, and validation artefacts for distribution.
Publishes the review objectives and logistics to participants at least 24 hours in advance.

name: AuditLaunchChecklist
summary: Validate Atlas launch checklist completion and evidence.
description: Review readiness checklist items, document outstanding tasks, and flag compliance or safety gaps before launch.
acceptance_criteria: Verifies each checklist item includes evidence or rationale for completion.
Records outstanding tasks with accountable owners and target resolution dates.
Escalates compliance or safety gaps requiring executive approval prior to launch.

name: EscalateOpenRisks
summary: Escalate unresolved Atlas launch risks to leadership channels.
description: Compile the remaining launch risks, notify the incident channel, and capture responses for accountability.
acceptance_criteria: Aggregates open risks with severity, owner, and mitigation status into the escalation message.
Delivers the escalation to the designated incident or leadership channel and confirms acknowledgement.
Captures follow-up actions or mitigation updates in the launch risk register.
